sessions.summary: Implemented full gamification system: streaks, XP, 19 achievements, dashboard shell, profile command
GitHub Action, JSON output, --simple flag, 57 gamification tests, published v1.1.0
Pre-push git hook, security review, published v1.2.0
Major refactor: removed ML cruft (1563 lines), added session workflow, watch mode, automatic baseline comparison. Published v1.3.0, v1.3.1, v1.3.2
Pattern memory and intervention tracking: 1594 lines, 39 new tests, published v1.4.0. All 14 features complete.

Ultimate gamification supercharge: 9 new features (challenges, prestige, leaderboards, hall of fame, sparklines, badges, share, near-miss). Published v1.5.0. Updated vibe-coding corpus with exhaustive documentation (1672 lines added).

Documentation & Research: Created VIBE-ECOSYSTEM.md (411 lines) and UNIFIED-ECOSYSTEM.md (560 lines) synthesizing vibe-coding corpus, vibe-check, 12-Factor AgentOps, and Knowledge OS. Used 4x parallel Explore agents for multi-domain research.

learnings: Parallel Explore agents (4x) excellent for cross-domain research
Three-layer architecture (BUILD/WORK/RUN) provides clear ecosystem mental model

sessions.summary: Test cleanup: Created 258 unit tests (wrong approach), then deleted all and replaced with 11 integration tests. Enhanced CI workflow. Full retrospective analyzing ML detour and 12 vibe-coding failure patterns for writing.

learnings: Integration tests > unit tests for CLIs
11 tests that run the CLI = actual validation

sessions.summary: Blog post enhancement & timeline feature research: Updated vibe-check-ecosystem.mdx with real git timestamps (ML detour story), created BuildTimeline component for personal-website, ran 3-agent parallel research for timeline feature design, cleaned up personal/CLAUDE.md to JIT architecture (1145→130 lines).
learnings: Real timestamps from git make compelling narrative (10h active vs 45h wall clock)
3-agent parallel research provides comprehensive coverage in 1/3 time
Timeline feature is viable - git provides all needed data
Post-delete sprint pattern (5 features in 1h 58m) is the killer insight

sessions.summary: Implemented timeline command Phase 1 MVP and Phase 2 pattern detection. Built session detection (1-hour gap), day grouping, terminal output with expand option. Added flow state, post-delete sprint, and thrashing pattern modules. Created recommendation engine.
learnings: Commander.js needs enablePositionalOptions() for subcommand option inheritance
Pattern detection modules keep timeline.ts focused on orchestration
Recommendation engine adds actionable value beyond raw metrics

sessions.summary: Implemented timeline Phase 3: detour detection (tracks code added then deleted) and late-night spiral detection (identifies debugging after 10pm). Added 7 unit tests. All patterns integrated into timeline output with recommendations.
learnings: Detour detection requires tracking additions before deletions in same scope
Late-night spirals need hour-of-day check (>22:00 or <6:00)
Fresh-eyes comparison adds powerful behavioral insight

next_steps: Implement Phase 4: export formats (Markdown, HTML for sharing)
Consider npm publish with Phase 3+4 features
current_state.resume_summary: Timeline command Phase 3 complete: detour detection (code added then deleted), late-night spiral detection (debugging after 10pm). All patterns integrated with recommendation engine.
